alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Marion; Stewart; Webster (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 03 at 11:30AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Marion, southeastern Chattahoochee, Stewart and western Webster Counties through NOON EDT... At 1130 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Providence Canyon State Park, or near Lumpkin, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lumpkin, Preston, Richland, Weston, Seminole, Charles, Kimbrough, Westville, Brooklyn, Renfroe, Zellobee, Sanford, Church Hill, Centerpoint, Louvale and Providence Canyon State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
